meanings.definition: A person who reads and writes in Braille.
meanings.sent1: The braillist helped the blind student read books.
meanings.sent2: The braillist at the library transcribed the menu into Braille for the visually impaired patrons.
meanings.sent3: The braillist made sure to dot all the i's and cross all the t's in the Braille book.
meanings.sent4: The braillist's fingers danced across the raised dots like a skilled pianist.
meanings.sent5: The braillist's expertise in Braille made the text come alive for the reader.

meanings.definition: A person who transcribes text into Braille.
meanings.sent1: The school hired a braillist to convert textbooks into Braille for the blind students.
meanings.sent2: The braillist carefully transcribed the lyrics of the song into Braille for the concert.
meanings.sent3: The braillist's desk was always covered in stacks of paper waiting to be converted into Braille.
meanings.sent4: The braillist's work was like turning words into secret codes for the visually impaired.
meanings.sent5: The braillist's dedication to transcribing text into Braille was truly admirable.
